name: Device has low capacity left or is full
description: Detects disk low capacity problems to give an early prediction for a possible capacity breach up to 15 minutes in advance. The detector is not firing when the remaining disk space is more than 1GB or 1% of the total capacity. However, it will fire if either the remaining disk space is empty (<1MB), or the disk space would fill up within the next 15 minutes based on the current trend.

hyperParams.name: Sliding Window
hyperParams.description: Sliding window

name: Sudden increase in latency for a fraction of all requests
description:
Detects a rapid increase in the given latency KPI percentile relative to the KPIs values in the last 30 minutes. The magnitude of the increase in latency should also exceed the relative and absolute threshold parameters below.
This rule is powered by a generic sudden drop/increase detector which is based on a modified version of the E-Divisive with Medians (EDM) algorithm for detection of changes in distribution of values of a given metric over the time.

hyperParams.name: EDM statistic threshold value
hyperParams.description: EDM statistic value quantifies the "suddeness" of the drop/increase observed in the metric value. Higher values of the statistic will result in sharper drops/increases being detected.

hyperParams.name: Absolute metric value shift
hyperParams.description: Threshold on the absolute shift in the metric value after a increase relative to the metric value before the increase

name: You will run out of disk space soon
description: Detects short-term capacity problems of a disk and fires when when the disk is likely to run out of capacity within the next hour. The detector is not firing when the disk freed up a considerable amount of space (>=100MB) in the recent past, or when the remaining disk space is more than 20% of the total capacity. However, it will fire when the disk space would fill up within the next hour based on the current trend. This trend is computed based on a linear regression model fitted on the data points of the current sliding window.

hyperParams.name: Sliding Window

name: Significant increase in compaction queue length
description:
This rules check for a sudden increase in the length of the compaction queue. When triggered, this rule indicates that the all regions are growingat a similar rate and need to split/compact at around the same time. This can be addressed by pre-splitting or turning off auto-compactions.
This rule is powered by a generic sudden drop/increase detector which is based on a modified version of the E-Divisive with Medians (EDM) algorithm for detection of changes in distribution of values of a given metric over the time.

hyperParams.name: EDM statistic threshold value
hyperParams.description: EDM statistic value quantifies the "suddeness" of the drop/increase observed in the metric value. Higher values of the statistic will result in sharper drops/increases being detected.

hyperParams.name: Relative metric value shift
hyperParams.description: Threshold on the relative shift in the metric value after a increase relative to the metric value before the increase

name: Disk fills up faster than it is being purged
description: Detects long-term disk capacity problems and fires when when the disk is likely to run out of capacity within the next 48 hours. The detector is not firing when the remaining disk space is more than 20% of the total capacity. However, it will fire when the disk space would fill up within the next 48 hours based on the current trend. This trend is computed based on local minima collected over time. When these local minima define a timeframe of at least 4 hours, a linear regression model is fitted on these data points to finally do the long-term forecast.

name: Complete drop in all calls
description:
Detects a rapid drop to zero (essentially the service is not being called anymore) in the values of the calls KPI metric relative to the values in the last 30 minutes. The magnitude of the drop in calls should also exceed the relative and absolute threshold parameters below.
This rule is powered by a generic sudden drop/increase detector which is based on a modified version of the E-Divisive with Medians (EDM) algorithm for detection of changes in distribution of values of a given metric over the time.

hyperParams.name: EDM statistic threshold value applied in case of zeros before/after increase/drop detection
hyperParams.description: EDM statistic value quantifies the "suddeness" of the drop/increase observed in the metric value. Higher values of the statistic will result in sharper drops/increases being detected. In situations when the metric value drops/increases to/from zero, lower statistic threshold could be used.

name: CPU Steal Time exceeded
description: Checks on a secondly moving window, whether there is too much CPU stolen between running processes or by the hypervisor / host OS. This rule checks if the CPU Usedis greater than the `Min CPU Used percentage` before evaluating the condition.

hyperParams.name: Sliding Window

hyperParams.description: Defines the number of allowed CPU Steal violations within the specified time window.

hyperParams.name: Min CPU Used percentage
hyperParams.description: Defines the minimum CPU Used percentage to calculate CPU Steal violations. Metric values exceeding this threshold are considered for the issue detection.

hyperParams.name: Max CPU Steal percentage
hyperParams.description: Defines the maximum allowed CPU Steal percentage. Metric values exceeding this threshold are considered as a violation.

name: Sudden increase in erroneous call rate
description:
Detects a rapid increase in the values of the erroneous call rate metric relative to the values in the last 10 minutes. The magnitude of the increase in erroneous call rate should also exceed the relative and absolute threshold parameters below. This rule only applies for Applications configured to use All Calls KPIs or that have not yet been configured to use by, default, either All Calls or Inbound Calls KPIs.
This rule is powered by a generic sudden drop/increase detector which is based on a modified version of the E-Divisive with Medians (EDM) algorithm for detection of changes in distribution of values of a given metric over the time.

hyperParams.name: EDM statistic threshold value applied in case of zeros before/after increase/drop detection
hyperParams.description: EDM statistic value quantifies the "suddeness" of the drop/increase observed in the metric value. Higher values of the statistic will result in sharper drops/increases being detected. In situations when the metric value drops/increases to/from zero, lower statistic threshold could be used.

hyperParams.name: EDM statistic threshold value
hyperParams.description: EDM statistic value quantifies the "suddeness" of the drop/increase observed in the metric value. Higher values of the statistic will result in sharper drops/increases being detected.

hyperParams.name: Relative metric value shift
hyperParams.description: Threshold on the relative shift in the metric value after a increase relative to the metric value before the increase

hyperParams.name: Absolute metric value shift
hyperParams.description: Threshold on the absolute shift in the metric value after a increase relative to the metric value before the increase
